message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product which we believe would greatly benefit your business. Given its value to you, I propose a starting price of $11,000. Let me know if this works for you or if you'd like to make a counteroffer.
Thanks for the offer, Alice.  I appreciate your enthusiasm, but $11,000 is a bit higher than I'm comfortable with right now. I'm willing to pay $9,500 for the product.  Let me know what you think.

Thank you for your response, Bob. I understand your position and respect your valuation of the product. To reach a mutually beneficial agreement, I am proposing a price of $10,750 for the product. This still reflects its value to you while allowing us to move forward with the transaction. Please let me know if this proposal works for you.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down on the price, but $10,750 is still a bit outside my budget. I'm prepared to offer $10,250 for the product. I believe this is fair, considering the value you've placed on it and my own budget constraints. Let's see if we can close this deal.

I appreciate your continued interest in our product, Bob. Considering the value it holds for both of us, I am willing to accept an offer of $10,500 for the product. This is a fair compromise that respects both our positions. I hope this meets your expectations, and we can finalize the transaction.
